name: Do You Know These Questioning Songs? Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Do You Know the Way to San Jose" was a top ten hit for which of these popular 1960's singers?
questions.explanation:
Dionne Warwick.

	Written by Burt Bacharach and Hal David,"Do You Know the Way to San Jose" was composed specifically for the lovely voice of Dionne Warwick. Released in 1968 this song made the charts in many countries, including Canada, the UK, Australia and South Africa.

questions.text: Which multi-talented British rocker had a 1973 hit with "Do You Feel Like We Do"?
questions.explanation:
Peter Frampton.

	Peter Frampton is recognised as one of the most influential early rock and roll singers. His song "Do You Feel Like We Do" was included on his second album "Frampton's Camel". Although the album was not a big hit, the song was popular and he included it in his live concerts for the next 40 years.

questions.text: "Do You Know Where You're Going To" a.k.a. "Theme from Mahogany" was a best selling song for which of the following singers in 1975?
questions.explanation:
Diana Ross.

	"Mahogany" was a 1975 movie that featured Diana Ross as the lead character. The song "Do You Know Where You're Going To" was considered the movie's theme song and was a big hit for the very talented Diana Ross. The song earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Song. Ross performed the song live at the awards ceremony via satellite from the Netherlands.

questions.text: "Do You Really Want to Hurt Me" was which British rock groups first big international hit when it was released in 1982?
questions.explanation:
Culture Club.

	Featuring the singer Boy George, Culture Club had a big hit when they released "Do You Really Want to Hurt Me" on their debut album "Kissing to Be Clever". The video of the song was also immensely popular. Culture Club was one of the early sounds of New Wave rock and had an international following. The voice of the androgynous Boy George gave the group the ability to sing many genres of music.

questions.text: "Do You Believe in Magic" was a big hit in 1965 for which American rock group who featured it in their debut album of the same name?
questions.explanation:
The Lovin' Spoonful.

	John Sebastian, lead singer for the rock group The Lovin' Spoonful wrote this song as well as performed it. The folk-rock group was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2000 in recognition of their contribution to the world of rock music.

questions.text: "Do You Want to Know a Secret" was a big hit in 1963 for which one of these immensely popular British rock group?
questions.explanation:
The Beatles.

	"Do You Want to Know a Secret" was a number one hit for the Beatles and the first to feature George Harrison singing the lead vocals. The song was featured on the group's 1963 album "Please,Please Me".

questions.text: "Do You Wanna Dance?" written by Bobby Freeman, was released in 1965 by which of these popular groups?
questions.explanation:
The Beach Boys.

	"Do You Wanna Dance?" was the highest rated song by the Beach Boys to feature Dennis Wilson on lead vocals. They sold over 100 million albums in the next 50 years and were inducted in the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1988.

questions.text: "Do You Love Me" was a song by which flamboyant rock group who featured it in 1976 on their fourth album "Destroyer"?
questions.explanation:
Kiss.

	The elaborate performance of the band Kiss made them a very popular group in the field of heavy metal rock. While this song was not particularly popular song, the album reached platinum status in 1976. Kiss' live performances involved wild costumes, pyrotechnics, the spitting of blood and fire breathing. Their shows were so wild that people who did not care for heavy metal would buy tickets just to see the special effects.

questions.text: In 1982, which American rock group scored their first top ten hit with the song "Do You Believe In Love"?
questions.explanation:
Huey Lewis and the News.

	Featured on the album "Picture This" by Huey Lewis and the News, "Do You Believe In Love" quickly shot to number seven soon after it was released. Huey Lewis and the News was a pop rock rock that reached their greatest popularity in the 1980's and 1990's. The group won two Grammy awards and was nominated for another two.

questions.text: "Do You Remember?" was a solo hit for which of these singers, who at one time performed with the progressive rock group Genesis?
questions.explanation:
Phil Collins.

	The multi-talented Phil Collins had a very successful career with the band Genesis as well as a solo career. This song was featured in his 1990 album "...But Seriously". The song had it's greatest popularity in Europe but was featured often on American radio stations at the time. Phil Collins won seven Grammy awards, an Academy Award and two Golden Globes by the time he was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of fame in 2000.
